answers.answer: What is your ferritin (iron stores) level like?  Low iron can cause rapid heart rate and dizzy feelings.  You can have low iron and a normal complete blood count.  Have they tested you to definitively rule out iron deficiency?Have they ever had an electrophysiologist (a type of cardiologist) conduct a tilt table test on you to see if you are struggling with a form of orthostatic intolerance?

Hi there. dizziness or light headedness could be due to various causes like low blood pressure, postural or orthostatic hypotension, high blood pressure, diabetes, hypo or hyper glycemia, endocrine diseases like hypo or hyperthyroidism, hyperventilation, heart conditions like cardiomyopathy, vasovagal syncope, etc. anemia due to  iron deficiency is also an important cause for dizziness. Consult a physician and get a run of multiple system blood tests including hormone assays, and a cardiac evaluation for the possible diagnosis. Take care.
